duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate firmwide strategic initiatives to attract, retain, and promote diverse talent, including training programs, professional development events, and client collaborations.
Execute and coordinate mentoring and sponsorship initiatives related to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI).
Fulfill, monitor, and update diversity-related data and requests; research DEI trends and contribute to the development of best practices.
Liaise with various committees and firm leaders to oversee the implementation of DEI initiatives laid out in the firm’s Diversity & Inclusion Plan.
Organize and support diverse employee resource groups in their programming, activities, and initiatives.
Manage client and third-party DEI requests, surveys, and billing responses, and analyze the effectiveness of external DEI programs.
Provide administrative support for special projects, maintain the firm's intranet and external website, and create DEI reports and presentations.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required; J.D. or Master’s degree preferred, or work experience comparable to a post-graduate degree preferred. Minimum of two (2) years of post-undergraduate experience, or 4 years of experience in place of an undergraduate degree, supporting and implementing DEI initiatives in a law firm or the private sector required, or at least one year of such experience with a DEI certificate conferred.
